activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No agreement.  JT 2/3/23.  Defendant must report to the jail to be fingerprinted before he leaves today.

10:18 AM Defendant Todd D Weldon appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Todd D Weldon.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter appeared by zoom.
Attorney Rockow relates.  Next hearing to be in person.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NG plea entered.

Testimony closed. Argument by Attorney Rockow. 2:58 Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Defendant must appear in person. Must be fingerprinted on 6/10/22. Must bring photo ID with.
